page.title: 06Mining Alston Moor
page.content: Alston has a long history of mining and there is much evidence of past lead/silver, zinc and coal extraction. Spoil heaps, mine shafts (currently being capped by the{Manpower Services) and adit entrances abound. Proposals this year to begin{open cast coal {mining}above Blagill have met with mixed reactions by the local people. While this may create a few vital jobs in this area of{high unemployment,}it is feared that it will cause pollution of water courses and disruption of the water table, furthermore, the roads around Alston were never designed to cope with the heavy traffic that would be involved.
